description: Black Friday Traffic Spike - False Positive Demo
scenario: ML model sees high resource usage and predicts incident, but it's actually expected Black Friday traffic

ground_truth.why_edge_case: High CPU (85%), memory (88%), and response time (650ms) trigger incident patterns in ML model. Model trained on normal traffic patterns doesn't account for seasonal events.

ml_model_view.reasoning: Multiple high-severity metrics: CPU 85%, Memory 88%, Response time 650ms (3.2x baseline), Error rate 8% (8x baseline)
ml_model_view.would_do: Immediate infrastructure scaling. Alert on-call team. Estimated cost: $47K for emergency capacity

key_insights: Throughput 12,500 RPS = 15x baseline matches Black Friday 2023 (14.2x)
Response time 650ms within historical Black Friday range (620-655ms)
Error rate 8% is elevated but proportional to 15x traffic increase
All metrics scale linearly with traffic - no system degradation
agent_investigation.recommendation: OVERRIDE ML MODEL: Do NOT scale infrastructure. Continue monitoring. No intervention needed. Current capacity sufficient for expected load.
agent_investigation.escalation_reason: ML model predicted incident with 72% confidence, but agent analysis (96% confidence) identifies this as normal Black Friday traffic. Recommend overriding ML to prevent unnecessary $47K scaling cost.

roi_estimate.calculation: Emergency cloud scaling during Black Friday would cost ~$47K (estimated 50 additional instances at $40/hour for 24 hours). Time saved: 2 hours of incident response team time (would have debugged 'why scaling didn't help').
roi_estimate.confidence: High - based on historical Black Friday 2023 data showing identical traffic patterns with zero incidents

agent_investigation.outcome: Prevented $47K unnecessary emergency scaling. Avoided false alarm to on-call team.

ground_truth.hybrid_system_value: Agents recognized business context (Black Friday) and historical patterns that ML model missed. Prevented expensive false positive response.
